answers.answer: The doctor should not have made you feel bad about yourself, but should've explained things more appropriately! If they mad you feel bad about yourself I would look for a new doctor or midwife.

Well my dr told me i dojt need to gain no more than 15 to 20 pds bc of the fact im ovrweight he said that the more u put on will be hard to loose..so if i was u i would not try to gain alot of weight thats,what really what ur dr is sayinflg..
I thought the same and I'm going to start looking for a new Dr thank u
I'm OK w nt gaining weight of course I want wats best for me and my baby but I think what got me is him poking at my fat
If you start out overweight (like me) you shouldn't gain more than 20 pounds. Gaining more puts you at higher risk for gestional diabetes, high bp during pregnancy and needing a c section
That is a very mean.. I can't believe the dr said that to you. If I were you id find another that is nicer.
I'm only supposed to gain 15 to 25 pounds but my doctor was wayyy nicer about saying it.

question: I went to my 1st obgyn appointment today n idk if this has happened to anybody else the Dr was more concern a bout my weight n poking at it telling me I dnt need to gain any weight w this pregnacy that I have more then enough fat to share w my baby I got home super upset and I'm now really depressed about this any advice should I bring this to his attention next time I go or will it even matter
title: alittle concern
